fields.description:
Please remove the minimize and maximize options from all dashboard gadgets.

These options provide no value (at least until our vendor decides to significantly improve the high-level dashboard layout options...at that seems unlikely).

Worse still, selecting maximize can lead to accidental recalculation of all gadget and data displayed when the option is disabled to return to full dashboard display.

Thank you.
fields.summary: remove the minimize and maximize options from dashboard gadgets

fields.description:
Having additional fields available would increase the possibilities of this Gadget.

One example is allowing the Estimated Time (_originalEstimate_) as a possible field, as well as  _timespent_.
fields.summary: Additional Fields to be used on Axis for the Two Dimensional Filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users without access to Jira (i.e. they only have access to Confluence) cannot see Public Dashboards.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have "Allow users to share dashboards and filters with the public" set to ON under General Configurations.
 # Create a Dashboard.
 # Make the Dashboard Public.
 # Log in with an account that doesn't have access to Jira and try to access the dashboard.

h3. Expected Results

The users should be able to see the dashboard.
h3. Actual Results

Users cannot see the dashboard. They get the following message:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-11 at 13.14.59.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Users need to be logged out in order to see the dashboard. They can use a different browser or the incognito window.
fields.summary: Users without access to Jira are unable to see Public Dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

On Single Line custom fields, if the text doesn't fit on the screen, there's no way to see its full content.

!image-2021-06-11-12-22-10-538.png|width=417,height=138!
h3. Suggested Solution

Ideally, the New Issue should wrap the text adapting to the screen size - as the old issue view used to work.
fields.summary: Enhance visibility of content on single line custom fields

fields.description:
Copying a slack link and paste the same in the Jira comments, we will note that the message displays as per the screenshot below :

!image-2021-06-11-15-30-46-200.png|width=371,height=129!

It would be looking neat if
 * we remove the highlighted slack icon which is useless in this case as there is already a line stating the same.
 * an option to furl and unfurl as per the requirement of the users.
 * Distinguish the message with a paragraph quote that would be useful.
fields.summary: Slack to have shortened and better display of message in the comment section

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to search issues platform-dependent characters like "⚠" in Advanced search and JQL.
However, it's possible to do that in Kanban board and quick search.
It would be great if Jira has the ability.
fields.summary: Ability to search platform dependent characters in Advanced search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For team-managed projects, if a user creates inline issues under the "Child issues" panel, trying to manually reorder them won't work until the page is refreshed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue under a team-managed project
 # Create one or more issues inline under "Child issues"
 # Try to reorder the newly created issues

h3. Expected Results

Issues can be reordered naturally.
h3. Actual Results

Only issues excluding the ones created inline can be sorted manually.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page after creating the issues inline to be able to sort all issues again.
fields.summary: Create inline issues on "child issues" makes manual sorting misbehave

fields.description: On larger screens, it would help to have all avatars displayed at the top of the board to make filtering easier/faster.
fields.summary: Display all user avatars at the top of a board on larger screens

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, it's only possible to view the Epic panel on the Web version.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add an option to enable Epic panel when viewing a project on Jira Cloud for Mac.
fields.summary: Ability to view Epic panel on Jira Cloud for Mac

fields.description:
h3. Current scenario
Currently, users can only perform imports if they are granted with the global permission *Administer Jira*.

h3. Desired scenario
It would be nice to be able to provide users with External Import permission without granting the rest of the Jira Admin permissions
fields.summary: Ability to provide users with External Import permission without granting the rest of the Jira Admin permissions

fields.description:
Jira Server uses a rich text editor which has a different formatting than the one used in Jira Cloud. When migrating from Server to Cloud the text will show all the formatting characters in Cloud, as the new issue view uses markdown which is not compatible with Server rich text editor formatting, resulting in all fields that support formatting to show junk text like this:

In Server:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
In Cloud:
 !image-2021-06-11-00-00-34-885.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the migration from Server to Cloud by converting the text formatting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Story Points field is visible on Issue Layout even without placed on the screens.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project 
 # Check if the Story Points field is placed on the screen of any issue type
 # If yes, remove it. If not, step 4.
 # Check the Issue Layout

h3. Expected Results

The Story Points field is not visible on Issue Layout
h3. Actual Results

The Story Points field is visible on Issue Layout
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Story Points field appearing in issue layout without placed on screens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a task contains subtasks and some subtasks have linked issues, cloning the task and including the substasks, the linked issues are missed. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an story/task and create a subtask
 # Open the subtask and link to any issue
 # Clone that story including the subtasks

Reproducing the problem: https://share.getcloudapp.com/6qur526E

h3. Expected Results
The subtask cloned will contain the linked issues
h3. Actual Results
The subtask cloned lose the linked issues

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clone feature is not carrying linked issues for child issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on "Log work" or "Comment" on a jira issue from the filter statistics gadget in the new dashboard UI does not return any action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the new dashboard UI, create a filter statistics gadget and choose a filter
 # Save the gadget
 # From an issue displayed in the gadget, try to "Log work" or "Comment"

_*Issue in the gadget > ... > Log Work / Comment*_
h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to log work or comment on issues from the gadget as expected
h3. Actual Results

"Log work" and "Comment" options are unresponsive and do not return any action
h3. Workaround

The users can "Right click" and open the link in the new tab for log work/comment from the gadget.


The same Bug was reported previously here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76303
fields.summary: Unable to log work & comment on jira issues from the filter results gadget in the Jira dashboard (new UI)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some customers are reporting that they are unable to log work for Jira issues if its in a laguage other than English

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the issue without time logged-> select Log work 
 # Enter the time then save. 

h3. Expected Results
Work should get logged and issue history should capture the same.

h3. Actual Results
* At times the "Save" button will be disabled. 
* If the work log is saved then issue history captures it as 0m. 


h3. Workaround
* In order to workaround the 0m problem -> Reload the issue and then edit the worklog entry to a different value, the work log entry will be saved as expected.
* For the "Save" button being disabled, for some customers editing the minutes section with format "1m" "2m" seems to enable the "Save" button.
fields.summary: Unable to Log work for tickets. Issue history shows 0m after adding work log entry.

fields.description:
It would be very useful to have a JIRA notification count marker overlayed on the JIRA browser tab favicon.

This will help the users know about any notifications that they need to attend.
fields.summary: Add a dynamic favicon with a JIRA notification count for the logged in user

fields.description:
In the old issue view when viewing at the top of the issue you would see the parent of the issue and the summary of it, in the new issue view this is not present. The request is to have the new issue view implement the same behavior as the old  issue view.

Old issue view:
 !image-2021-06-10-16-48-37-000.png|thumbnail! 

New issue view:
 !image-2021-06-10-16-49-09-196.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display the summary of the sub-task parent in the hierarchy like in the old issue view

fields.description:
In the old issue view, admin has more options to customize the date and date/time fields. This includes making displaying date/time in 12hr/24hr format, and having Monday as your first day of the week, displaying seconds, etc. In the new view, the view and display of these fields are limited to the setup of a customer's locale.

In the old view, such further flexibility can be achieved via Advanced admin property which customize the edit experience at Admin level([https://date-time.jira-dev.com/secure/admin/*AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa*]) and the look and feel setting which customize the view experience at admin level (Link [https://date-time.jira-dev.com/secure/admin/*LookAndFeel!default.jspa*])
h3.
fields.summary: Allow further customization for date and date/time field (that's not limited to locale)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Workflow properties set in statuses do not have the same behavior in transitions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a workflow
 # Select a status (say status A) in the workflow, and add the property jira.permission.comment.denied (with no value).
(with no value).
# Publish changes

h3. Expected Results
When on status A and transitioning to another status and getting a screen for that, it is possible to add a comment during in the transition screen as long as the target status allows comments.

h3. Actual Results
When on status A and transitioning to another status and getting a screen for that, it is not possible to add a comment.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Workflow properties set in statuses do not have the same behavior in transitions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you open issue modally from board using touch device (eg: iPad), you will not able to scroll in that view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open board using desktop version in iPad
 # Open an issue with long description or long field list
 # Try to scroll down

h3. Expected Results

Able to scroll down to see whole content
h3. Actual Results

The issue modal won't able to scroll
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't scroll down on issue view using touch device

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Convert to subtask is missing in sidebar or modal view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open issue view in sidebar or modal view,
 # Open the meatball menu
 # Convert to sub-task will be missing

h3. Expected Results

Convert to sub task is available
h3. Actual Results

Convert to subtask is missing
h3. Workaround


Open issue view in full issue view
fields.summary: Convert to subtask is missing in sidebar or modal view

fields.description:
Would be great to have the ability to reorder the items there, so users can set it based on their own relevance or have the possibility to create folders/tabs.
 !image-2021-06-09-18-07-13-804.png|width=322,height=673!
fields.summary: Ability to reorder the shortcuts and links on project left tab.

fields.description:
The pro-tip promotes the use, but is not that intuitive.

Users need to use the right-click emoji search to actually add emojis there. Having this also showing on the tooltip will clarify the use by now.

Consider enabling the ":" markup.

!image-2021-06-09-17-57-54-553.png|width=433,height=315!
fields.summary: Ability to use ":" marks to add emojis when adding shortcut to Jira project left tab

fields.description:
If you want to create a new subtask from the parent screen, the selected subtask type is not kept in the create issue screen. It autoselects the last subtask type used.

It could be really helpful to keep the value when the create screen is required to populate required fields.

Please refer to the attached video.

Note: the default behavior of the create issue screen is to autoselect the last issue type selected.
fields.summary: Create popup doesn't keep subtask issue type selected from parent's issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The smart link did not work properly using shift + mouse click.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a smart link into a comment.
 # Then use shift + mouse click

* [Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/4guny17z] showing this bug.
h3. Expected Results
It should open the link into another browser window. 

h3. Actual Results
It will open the link on the same browser window.

h3. Workaround
No workaround is available yet.
fields.summary: Smart link did not work properly using shift + mouse click

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users set Spanish/Chinese as the language in the personal settings, Jira translates the time notation but wrongly doesn't accept that format. This Bug affects all languages:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When users set Spanish as the language in the settings,
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Jira translates the time notation but wrongly doesn't accept that format. This Bug affects all languages:
| !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! | !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! |
|Spanish|Chinese|
 

h3. Expected Results

Jira shouldn't translate the time's notation. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira translates the time tracking convection, but it doesn't accept it. 
h3. Workaround

manually fix the time notation in the remaining time field.
fields.summary: Worklog time cannot be saved due to Language settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new issue view, in the issue description or in a multi-line text custom field, if you add a URL that is not *http*, *https*, *ftp* or *mailto*, this is not rendered as a link but it is shown as single text:
 !01-Links-multi-line-text.jpg|thumbnail!

Everything works fine when using a single-line text field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the new issue view, in an issue description enter a valid URL like, for example [ftp://something.org|ftp://something.org/]
 # See that after hitting enter, the string is correctly rendered as a link
 # Now repeat the same test but enter any of the following URLs: [ftps://something.com] or gopher://something.org or integrity://something.org or smb://, file:// etc, and hit enter.

h3. Expected Results

All the URLs are correctly rendered as links 
h3. Actual Results

The URLs are rendered as simple text strings and are not clickable.
h3. Workaround

In some cases, for the most used protocols like ftps:// and SCP, using the markdown syntax '[TEXT-HERE] (URL-HERE)' for links works:
 !02-markdown-workaround-ok.jpg|thumbnail!

However, by using the markdown syntax using less common protocols like for example gopher:// or integrity:// or [nntp://], the text is rendered as a link, but it is creating a broken link that is missing the URL:
 !03-markdown-not-ok.jpg|thumbnail!

Another workaround, when applicable, is to use a single-line text field since everything is correctly rendered as a link in there.
fields.summary: In the new issue view, in a multi-line text custom field or in the issue description field,  not all the URLs are rendered as links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Automation rule does not display the count of rule components. There are few "hidden" components that are available in the JSON export and one particular type (jira.condition.container.block) actually counts towards the service limit. This creates a problem when you are still expecting the count has not hit the limit.

Especially, if the rule includes the _If..else_ component (jira.condition.container.block).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new rule
 # Add components with _if..else_ conditions (say ~58 of them)
 # The Rule won't allow you to add any more component irrespective of the count from the UI search suggest that the total count is less than the service limit of 65.

h3. Expected Behaviour

Users should be able to clearly see the number of components currently used in their rules and possibly restricted from creating a new component once limit is reached.
h3. Actual Results
 * Adding any new component will result in the below error even though _visually_ you seem to have less than 65 components
 !A4j Error.png|thumbnail!
 * Here is an additional understand if your rule is impacted due to this problem
 ** Download the JSON file for the rule
 ** Look for the count of - "jira.condition.container.block" element. This is the additional component being taken into consideration by the validation logic towards the count of components.

h3. Workaround

None as this is a usability bug. However, if you are hitting the service limit then you may need to split the rule.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira does not display the current count of components

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for a filter owned by a user the Filter or Project Picker to be used on a Dashboard gadget the search result returns all filters visible to the user searching it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Gadget to a dashboard (Eg Pie Chart)
 # Click on the Advanced Search.
 # Navigate to the Search Tab.
 # Select an owner on the user picker field.

h3. Expected Results

The search results should only contain a list of filters owned by the user we are searching for.
h3. Actual Results

The search result shows all available filters.
h3. Workaround

Search for a filter using the filter name instead
fields.summary: When searching for a filter owned by a user the Filter or Project Picker returns all filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to export large files when opening using "Excel worksheet”

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From Jira advanced search, filter issues such that there are 20k+ rows.
 # Try exporting these files using the Excel add-on on the top right corner of the search

h3. Expected Results
The files should have been downloaded.

h3. Actual Results
It gives a 504 gateway error

h3. Workaround
Export the file in smaller bacthes.
fields.summary: Unable to export large files when opening using "Excel worksheet”

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to search for issues with more than 3 multibyte characters on the mobile app. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create an issue that summary is "テスト"
 # search for issues with "テスト"

h3. Expected Results
It will show an issue that is created step 1.

h3. Actual Results
It shows “No matches”.
 !image-2021-06-09-12-06-40-593.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to search for issues with more than 3 multibyte characters on the mobile app

fields.description: When doing bulk update for transition and select issues from different workflows, the UI shows the transition from multiple workflows but it only allows to select one of the workflows. It will be nice if we can select multiple workflows and transition all at once.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk update the transition from multiple workflows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The character '&' incorrectly formatted in Heat Map gadget
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type Select List (multiple choices)
 # Create different options for the field, including some with the character '&' present
 !image-2021-06-09-11-52-57-131.png|width=110,height=80!
 # Populate a few issues with these options
 # Create a gadget of type Heat Map configured to pull issues where this CF has values. See the character '&' formatted incorrectly and the word 'None' much bigger than the rest:
 !image-2021-06-09-11-55-13-566.png|width=327,height=95!
 # Upon clicking on the option where '&' is present, the JQL populates correctly:
 !image-2021-06-09-11-56-48-667.png|width=350,height=138!

h3. Expected Results

The character '&' to format correctly
h3. Actual Results

The character '&' is formatted as
{code:java}
&{code}
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: The character '&' incorrectly formatted in Heat Map gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The regex is not being respected on Transition issue > 'transition match' action
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a workflow with multiple transitions going to the same status. E.g, destination status is 'In Progress', and the two transitions leading to it are 'In Progress' and 'In Progress_review'.
 # Create a rule with action to 'Transition issue' and set a regex for 'Transition match':
!image-2021-06-09-12-11-00-944.png|width=251,height=160!   
 # The transition matching the regex is the one with id=61 ('In Progress_review'):
!image-2021-06-09-12-12-10-251.png|width=231,height=146!
 4. When the rule ran, it transitioned the issue via the transition with id=31, which matches the 'In Progress' transition:

 !image-2021-06-09-10-48-35-090.png|width=307,height=166!

h3. Expected Results

When the rule runs, it is expected that the transition that will move the issue to the destination status is the one matching the regex in 'transition match'.
h3. Actual Results

The regex is not respected
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: The regex is not respected on Transition issue > 'transition match' action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sorting by release date does not work
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule to set the 'Fix versions' value to 'Next unreleased version'
 # Chose any trigger, e.g on issue create
!image-2021-06-09-08-31-52-464.png|width=362,height=143!
 # Publish the rule

h3. Expected Results

Sorting by date to work 
h3. Actual Results

Sorting does not work, cannot determine which unreleased version will be assigned if there are more than 2 unreleased versions
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Automation for Jira not sorting by release date

fields.description: It would be helpful to be able to filter tickets by status in the backlog in the event they're not all in To Do status.
fields.summary: Option to filter tickets by status in backlog

fields.description: It would be helpful to have a speech to text or voice to text option in Jira when creating issues.
fields.summary: Speech to text functionality

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing Advanced Roadmap’s Target Start and Target End fields through Jira’s Issue view results in the value stored under the issue history showing the previous day instead of the actual set date.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any issue that contains Fields Target Start and Target End;
 # Edit these fields accordingly.

h3. Expected Results

The field set date and the recorded value under issue history should match.
h3. Actual Results

The value stored under activity stream is -1 day instead.

!replicated.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Setting fields Target Start and Target end through Jira issue view results in mismatching values stored under issue history

fields.description:
When spike work is completed, the current process is to go to the create button, create the issue, fill out the details then link the issue.

 

Proposed idea - To be allowed to create issues from the Link drop down on an issue. When you click the dropdown bar it shows all jiras, there should be a "create issue" at the top of the dropdown so that the issue you create is automatically linked to the previous Jira. I spend most of my time doing spikes then creating issues after if it is a real bug/dev story and would be a nice to have!
fields.summary: Allow creation of Issues from Link Issue drop down

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
iOS Jira App: when a Sprint has a completed task but one sub-task is still not closed the iOS Jira App returns a 400 error when trying to complete a Sprint, it should be something indicating not completed subtasks like the message displayed in the browser.
 !image-2021-05-31-13-52-45-670.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-05-31-13-53-35-765.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Sprint and add one issue to it
 # Create a Subtask inside the issue
 # Transition the parent issue to a done status and leave the sub-task open
 # Try to complete the Sprint 

h3. Expected Results
Jira should return an error indicated not completed sub-tasks

h3. Actual Results
Jira is returning a 400 error

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira is returning a 400 error when trying to complete a Sprint with a done task that has not completed sub-tasks on iOS App

fields.description:
Provide an option to delete the "*Fire event*" notification from the workflow post function.

Currently for "Create issue" transition and other transitions in the workflow consists of "*Fire event*" however, it is not possible to delete this event from the post function.
fields.summary: Delete the Fire event notification from the workflow post function.

fields.description: For some of the projects, the admins need the ability to disable the permission-related warning message that shows up as their use case requires them to be able to revoke the permissions related to delete issues and close issues for some of the user groups and roles.
fields.summary: ability to disable the permission related to warning message by the admins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
All Issues Filter returns incorrect results if a sub-filter is used and Project name same as another project's project key

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create projects:
Project one: Name: Ad Management Key: *ADM* 
Project two: Name: *AdM* Key: AADM
# Go to project one "Ad Management" > Issues > All issues
→ You will see all issues under the project
# select a sub-filter like "Status Category" 

h3. Expected Results
All issues that are under the sub-filter should show on screen

h3. Actual Results
Issues are not shown although they fit the filter chosen and you get:
"
No issues were found matching your search
"

On the same screen if you hover or click on "Go to advanced search" option, will show that the project under this filter is being picked as project two:
{code}project = "AADM" AND statuscategory = "New" ORDER BY created DESC{code}

instead of 
{code}project = "ADM" AND statuscategory = "New" ORDER BY created DESC{code}

Seems that the wrong project key is selected due to it matching the second project's name

h3. Workaround
Change the name of the second project to something else. For example for the above, changing the project two's name to "ADMT" would fix the issue.
fields.summary: All Issues Filter returns incorrect results if a sub-filter is used

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Visiting project page when you have no browse permission results in blank page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a project that uses a scheme whereby you do not have browse projects permission
 # Go to Projects > Click on that project

h3. Expected Results
404 shown

h3. Actual Results
Blank page shown: 
{code}/rest/internal/2/projectlandingpage/{PROJECT_KEY}{code} serves 404
See attachment

If you refresh the page it shows 404 error message: {code}/projects/{PROJECT_KEY}{code}

h3. Workaround
Refresh page again.
fields.summary: Visiting project page when you have no browse permission results in blank page

fields.description:
Suggestion to enhance the Group Management in Admin

Add the ability to Categorize Groups (or similar functionality).  Like Projects (or similar) ability to create and manage categories for Groups

*Use Case*

As a company, I need the ability to parse the user groups with a category to ultimately analyze and charge back for activity.
fields.summary: Enhance Group Management in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Epic name field shows mentioned issues as links instead of regular text on JQL results, despite showing regular text on the issue detail view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and mention another issue on the Epic Name field.
 # Search for the created issue using JQL

h3. Expected Results
Have the Epic Field showing its content without any link, just like on the issue detail view.

h3. Actual Results
It shows the Epic name field with a link for another issue.

h3. Workaround
none
fields.summary: Epic name field shows mentioned issues as link instead of regular text on JQL results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira is not triggering notifications for issue create action on Slack.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Slack integration with Jira configured to send messages when an issue is created
 # Create an one issue

h3. Expected Results

The Slack room receives the notification from issue created.
h3. Actual Results

No notification is sent to the room.
h3. Workaround

Check your workflow, if there are any custom events in the post function and ensure that the issue created event is set.
fields.summary: Custom events in post function is not recognized by Slack

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

When creating a User Picker (multi and single) and adding to screens of JSW and JWM projects, customers will also show as a suggestion when searching for users.

For the User Picker (single user), it's possible to add a "User filtering", but for User Picker (multiple users), it's not.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add a checkbox on the context for the administrator to select if they want or not customers to show on the list.
fields.summary: Customers shouldn't be suggested on User Picker custom fields on non-Jira Service Management projects

fields.description: When using multiple triggers. It would be a great development, if we could use a 'If <trigger name>' - else -conditions to our automations.
fields.summary: Conditions for Multiple triggers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to pin the knowledge base suggestions to the top, we get a positive message but no result. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a ticket in a project that has a knowledge base
 # Pin the knowledge base

h3. Expected Results
The knowledge base shows at the top of all fields

h3. Actual Results
The knowledge base continues to show in the bottom of the fields. 

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to pin Knowledge base in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Previously, "Share to Slack" button was enabled due to experiment. Now, it was disabled due to bugs. Users are very used using the share button.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable back the "Share to Slack" share button 
 !Screenshot 2021-05-10 at 11.14.57 AM (1).png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Turn on "Share to Slack" share button

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When using a condition set up for an issue type in a project with AND condition [branched(2 conditions)(Any) and (1 condition)], the string comparison != does not seem to be working. Please see the snapshots below. Looks like the String comparison is not working on *Any of the condition criteria*
h3. Environment

JS company managed workflows
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Set up a condition on a transition( name the transition) of the workflow
 Add condition on a transition to a status ( eg to inprogress)
 Select value field, click add.
 Snapshot attached- 
 Conditions to set up: Select any field and value
 ALL
{quote}Any
{quote}
1.The field projectdetail will have to be not equal to value 'admin'. Compared as String.
 Add grouped condition 
 2.The field projectdetail will have to be not equal to value 'APJ'. Compared as String.
{quote}3.The field projectdetail will have to be not equal to value 'NULL'. Compared as String.
{quote}
 

Publish the workflow
 Now create an issue and select the values as Admin or APJ for field project detail
h3. Expected Results

-When selecting the field value Admin or APJ ,the transition should not show up to move the case to Inprogress-

The the configuration for the condition was (Not 'admin' OR Not 'APJ') and not empty. The actual result below are expected in this scenario. The desired behaviour is achieved by using the 'All of' composite rather than then 'Any of' composite condition. 'All of' acts like an 'AND' and 'Any of' acts like an 'OR'.
h3. Actual Results

When selecting the field value Admin or APJ ,the transition shows up to move the case to Inprogress, which make the condition fail and not working as expected.
 Snapshots attached
h3. Notes

When configuring a composite workflow condition keep in mind that 'Any of' acts like an OR and 'All of' acts like an AND.
fields.summary: String type comparison != not working on "Any one of the condition" criteria for field value

fields.description:
As a Jira Administrator, I should be able to create a new Jira Project with the same Issue Layout as another existing project's Issue Layout (similar to the shared configuration). 

Yes, thanks to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71630 admins can push a button and copy the issue layout to other projects. The additional manual steps to create a project with the desired Issue Layout is painful and it should really all happen during project creation.
fields.summary: create new projects with the same issue layout as another project

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior
Enter key upon label selection simply select the label to the field and enables user to select another one

h3. Desired behavior
It would be nice if the enter key upon label selection to actually make the field change instead of simply selecting it
fields.summary: Change label selection behavior with Enter key to actually make the field change instead of simply selecting it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking the checkbox itself "Allow issues in any status to move to this one" nothing happens.

It's necessary to click the text, the checkbox itself isn't clickable either to activate or deactivate the feature.

The box itself should be clickable.

Tested on Chrome and Edge.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edir workflow on team-managed project
 # Click any status
 # Try to click the checkbox itself to enable "Allow issues in any status to move to this one"

h3. Expected Results

The box will be checked/unchecked

!image-2021-06-04-12-29-24-031.png|width=503,height=253!
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.
h3. Workaround

Click the text next to the checkbox
fields.summary: Clicking the checkbox itself to "Allow issues in any status to move to this one" on team-managed projects doesn't work

fields.description: Provide an ability to search for remote Jira server issues from a Jira cloud instance, considering that the Jira Cloud and Jira Server instances are linked with an Application link.
fields.summary: Search Issues from remote Jira Server connected with an Application link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Groups removed from instance are still returned in the permission schemes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new group
 # Grant a permission to that group inside a permission scheme
 # Call the Get permission scheme API method -> The group is returned
 # Remove the group from the instance

h3. Expected Results
 * Group is not visible in the permission scheme UI.
 * Group is not returned via Get permission scheme API.

h3. Actual Results
 * Group still appears inside the permission scheme UI.
 * Call the Get permission scheme API method -> The group is still returned.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Groups removed from instance are still used by permission schemes

fields.description:
The current create issue dialog is not populated based on the tab's project context, rather, it is populated based on the last project the user has interacted with. Some users work under different projects and switch context often, and due to the current behavior of the Create Issue Dialog it makes this work style difficult. 

It has been mentioned that this behavior will change in the next iteration of the issue creation dialog ([please see this comment in JRACLOUD-69274|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69274?focusedCommentId=2384393&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2384393])and this suggestion is to both request this request and track the interest for it.
fields.summary: When working with multiple web browser tabs the Create issue dialog indicates a project different than the one selected in that tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Moving a Multi-line text Custom Field out of Description area to Context area, ends up moving a different field altogether.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

From Project Settings> Issue layout, Move a Custom field of type Multi-line Text from the Description area to Context or Hidden fields. 

!1.jpg|width=583,height=290! 
 !2.jpg|width=581,height=293! 
 !3.jpg|width=575,height=294! 
 !4.jpg|width=570,height=291!

An entirely different custom field will be moved instead of the one selected and the selected Field stays within the Description area. 

The Problem is presented randomly on some projects and on some other projects, the correct multi-line text fields can be moved out of Description area without encountering this issue. 
h3. Expected Results

Only the Selected field is moved out of Description Area
h3. Actual Results

In first few attempts, wrong custom field will be moved. 
h3. Workaround

Retry to move the field out of the Description area and Save the changes anyway. In 2-3 attempts, one should be able to move the correct Field and save the changes.
fields.summary: Moving a Multi-line text Custom Field out of Description area to Context area, moves the wrong field.

fields.description:
Users who are used to the old issue view could benefit from the ability of collapsing the context field panel and also when the menu panel or the context field panel are collapsed the description field panel should be resized accordingly instead of leaving blank spaces.

See the example screenshot:
fields.summary: New issue view: Ability to collapse context fields panel and resize description fields panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Ability to set the reporter as required into the issue collector form.

(!) Note, the feature request is to fill out the report through UI as a field required.

I have created [this example|https://share.getcloudapp.com/mXurEDz0] of which we should expect with this suggestion. Ability to set it to be required under the form.

h3. Context
Due to some security changes on how some browsers would handle cookies. This has impacted how cross-site cookies are no longer supported in a few browsers, such as Google Chrome, which essentially prevents us to match the user in the Issue Collector by its session on Jira. 

Now, we cannot retrieve the reporter via cookies as appear [here|https://share.getcloudapp.com/yAuroJyx]
fields.summary: Ability to set the reporter as required into the issue collector form

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new List view of Business projects should allow users to include more fields, not just the predefined.

 

!image-2021-04-28-16-11-33-144.png|width=508,height=172!
fields.summary: Business List view must include more fields

fields.description:
In my company we use the two software JIRA project types:
 * Company-managed software (Classic projects): For most of projects that require to follow business investment.
 * Team-managed software (Next-Gen projects): For all other cases.

As Team-managed software are created by anyone in the organization, we need to find a way to get data only from "Company-managed software" projects.

 

It is very important, specially when we import data to EazyBI as I want to avoid the noise from the "team-managed projects" (custom fields, workflows, states...)

 

It would be very interesting to have a field that can be used from JQL to select only issues/data from "Company-managed software" projects?

(I imagine that, it would be also interesting to use that field to get data only from "Team-managed software" projects)
fields.summary: JQL field to get data only from Company-managed software

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Recently came across an issue where when trying to clone an issue in new issue view, errors out with a message as "Check your connection and try again"

!image-2021-06-03-19-17-46-791.png|width=381,height=118!

In the old issue view, we get an appropriate message to why we are not able to clone the issue. Screenshot attached 

!image-2021-06-03-19-18-28-685.png|width=387,height=169!
h3. Expected Results

A valid error message to display on the screen so that we can get the right solution without any delay.
h3. Actual Results

Invalid error messages appear on the screen.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Irrelevant error message in new issue view compared to old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a multi-line text field is cleared it will prevent issues from being transitioned if there is a regex validator on the transition
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a field of type multi-line text.
 # Add a workflow validator
 # Choose "Regular Expression check"
 # Choose a Multi line text field and in the regular expression type .*
 # Click on Add
 # Publish the workflow
 # Create an issue
 # Set the multi-line text field to a value
 # Unset the multi-line text
 # Perform the transition

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to transition the issue even though the field is empty
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2021-06-09 at 11.13.30 am.png|width=277,height=95!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour.
fields.summary: Regex in workflow validator for multi-line text custom field does not work as expected

fields.description:
The current service limits here: [What are service limits?|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/what-are-service-limits/] users would like to have the option to reset it if the rule gets throttled.

Proposed Solution:
 * Increase the limits
 OR
 * Make it chargeable to execute rules above the service limit
fields.summary: Reset service limit for automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team-managed project issue added to a Sprint from a different project makes the Sprint visible in the team-managed backlog in Jira Mobile
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Find an issue from a team managed project (let's call it Project 1)
 # Add it to an existing sprint (Sprint 2) from a different team managed project (Project 2) via the Sprint picker
!image-2021-06-03-12-18-30-819.png|width=332,height=176,thumbnail!
 # Check the backlog view of Project 1 in Jira Mobile
 # See that Sprint 2 is visible in Project 1 in mobile while in the web version is not

h3. Expected Results

Team managed backlog should only show sprints that belong to that board. (Meaning that Sprint 2 should not be visible in Project 1)
h3. Actual Results

Sprint 2 is visible in Project 1 using Jira Mobile
h3. !image-2021-06-03-12-18-02-135.png|width=301,height=241,thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team-managed project issue added to a Sprint from a different project makes the Sprint visible in the team-managed backlog in Jira Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After a user is deleted from the site who created dashboards, those dashboards also get deleted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User 2 creates a dashboard with "My organisation" access.
!dashboard - Step 1. dashboard created by user who will be deleted.png|width=330,height=228,thumbnail!
 # User 1 navigates to the dashboard list and can see and access the dashboard from Step 1.
 !Dashboard - Step 2. dashboard viewable by other users before user is deleted.png!

 # User 1 removes User 2 from the site.
 !dashboard - Step 3. remove User 2.png!

 # User 1 navigates to the dashboard list.

h3. Expected Results

User 1 can see the dashboard in the list.
h3. Actual Results

User 1 cannot see the dashboard in the list.

!Dashboard - Actual User 1 can NOT see the dashboard in the dashboard page.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting a user from the site will remove dashboards they created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a touch screen on Windows 10 with Google Chrome (only tested on this particular environment, maybe other browsers impacted), Issues can't be transitioned on a Board by drag & drop when using the touch screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any Board in Jira
 # Try to transition an Issue with the touch screen feature 

h3. Expected Results

The Issue is transitioned
h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens, please see the attached video:
 [^Touchscreen test-1.mp4] 

Nothing happens
h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround is to use a mouse to transition the Issues
fields.summary: Transitioning an Issue by drag & drop on a Touch Screen is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to remove resolution from the transition entirely, even if it's mandatory on the issue, which lets the user transition the issue without setting it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an open ticket with required resolution field
 # Go to transition options, set a certain screen for close transition (I chose Resolve Issue screen).
 # Make sure that the screen you chose does not have the "resolution" field.
 # The ticket is closed without resolution set (it is Unresolved - that means resolution is null - which is wrong)

h3. Expected Results

The transition should not be possible without setting the resolution, therefore removing the resolution from a transition on a project where resolution is mandatory shouldn't be possible or maybe there should be a notification for the user that something may be wrong.
h3. Actual Results

The ticket can be closed successfully - with null resolution.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
h3. If you need my help, feel free to ask!
fields.summary: You can remove the resolution from the "close" transition despite it being present on an issue and required on closing

fields.description:
Problem Statement:
Creating a project using the official REST API for creating a project: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-projects/#api-rest-api-3-project-post,
POST /rest/api/3/project

results in a well configured project (all schemes specified in the request are assigned to the project) but many other configuration elements are created and stay unused.
The project will be first created with default configurations, and then they are replaced with the one that you have specified. Hence there is no possibility to remove those configurations by default.

Suggestion :
 if we specify a scheme to be assigned to a project upon creation no additional scheme should be created and left unused.
.
fields.summary: Unused configuration when creating Jira Service Desk project using REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The audit log shows changes to statuses, such as name update. 

Currently, if the status has a translation, and a user with the language that matches that translation set on their profile updates a status, the audit log will not log the information *From* and *To* as in the example below that shows that the name of the status changed from *Waiting for support* to *Waiting for support s*:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-02 at 10.38.01.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Add a translation to a status
** PT-BR translation for *In Progress* = *Em andamento*
* Set your Atlassian account's language to the language that matches the one from the translation
* Update the name of the status
* Check the audit log

h3. Expected Results

The audit log will display the status update, showing what was the previous name of that status as well as the new one.

h3. Actual Results

Although the audit log does log the update, no information about the values that changed are displayed:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Audit log missing information about status update

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When filtering the list of fields to add to a screen, entering text in Japanese does not find the expected fields unless there is a prefix match specifically. The same search in English works as an arbitrary substring match.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with the Jira system language set to Japanese.
 # Go to the fields configuration screen for any screen for that project, which will have available fields in Japanese.
 # Search for a suffix-matching string. For example, the IT Service Management template has the field "解決までの時間". Searching for "解決" returns the expected results, but searching for "時間" returns no results.

h3. Expected Results

See step 3 of steps to reproduce.
h3. Actual Results

See the available fields:

!image-2021-06-02-23-22-36-508.png|width=497,height=542!

Results for a prefix:

!image-2021-06-02-23-23-26-364.png|width=489,height=510!

And for a suffix, nothing:

!image-2021-06-02-23-23-45-845.png|width=446,height=419!
h3. Workaround

Search by prefix for Japanese field names.
fields.summary: Searching for a field in Japanese on /admin/ConfigureFieldScreen.jspa uses a prefix match rather than a full search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Ability to share issue layout between projects is being rolled out to customers as per the ticket https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71630.
However, currently this is not working for Sub-task issue type, although UI says the layout was successfully copied.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure that issue type Sub-task is the only issue type in the Screen scheme and is shared with Sub-tasks of different project. ( refer attachment) 
 # Navigate to Edit issue layout , then click on "Copy Issue layout".
 # You will be prompted with "choose destination Project". Note that this screen does not display the issue type "Sub-task" as well. ( refer screenshot)
# Review and then copy. We get a successful message that the issue layout was copied.

h3. Expected Results
Issue layout should be copied for Sub-task issue types.

h3. Actual Results
Although there is a success message, but the issue layout will NOT be copied for sub-task

h3. Note
This happens only when issue type sub-task has a different screen scheme in the project. If it shares the screen scheme with other issue types , then issue layout is copied as expected.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copy Issue layout does not work for Issue type Sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, on Jira apps (Mac, Android and iOS), it's only possible to create Issues in this Epic/Child issues on team-managed projects.

On company-managed projects, we can only link issues or create sub-tasks.

To create child issues, it's necessary to use the web version.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the ability to create Issues in this Epic/Child issues on company-managed projects too, since sub-tasks and linked issues won't show on Roadmaps.
fields.summary: Ability to create "Issues in this Epic" on company-managed projects (mobile/Jira Cloud for Mac app)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently , when user go to Profile>Edit Preferences>Time Zone dropdown there are no Bratislava Time Zone (GMT+1) in the dropdown under the Europe time zone
h3. Suggested Solution

When user go to Profile>Edit Preferences>Time Zone, user should be able to select the Bratislava Time Zone (GMT+1) in the dropdown under the Europe time zone
fields.summary: Add Bratislava Time Zone (GMT+1) in the User Preference time zone

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is unable to create Standard Issue Types or subtask using native iOS App or native Mac App if it has required field.

App will show ambiguous error "*An unspecified HTTP 400 error occurred*"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Issue that able to create subtask which has required field
 # Type subtask summary then press "return"

h3. Expected Results

If creating subtask has required field, app should show create issue modally and able to input all the required fields.
h3. Actual Results

App will show error "*An unspecified HTTP 400 error occurred"*

*!IMG_B9C0669831BA-1.jpeg|width=67,height=147!*
h3. Workaround

Use browser version to create these subtask
fields.summary: Create subtask that has required field using native iOS app results error 400

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a Srcum project and select "Share settings with an existing project" it does not create Backlog, Active sprints and Roadmap

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create project
 # Select checkbox *Share settings with an existing project*
#  Select another Scrum project to share the settings

h3. Expected Results

To create the scrum project that includes Backlog, Active sprints, and Roadmap

h3. Actual Results

It creates a project that does not have Backlog, Active sprints and Roadmap

h3. Workaround

Don't select *Share settings with an existing project* during project creation
 OR
Manually create a scrum board and associate it with the new project
fields.summary: When creating a Scrum project and select " Share settings with an existing project " it does not create Backlog, Active sprints and Roadmap

fields.description:
Availability to Share Dashboards with Groups where you as an Owner of the Dashboard is not part of the Groups that you would like to share.
h3. Workaround

Create Groups to specifically share Dashboards or get one of the users that is a member from the Group to share, create the Dashboard
fields.summary: Availability to Share Dashboards with Groups where you as an Owner of the Dashboard is not part of the Groups

fields.description:
Recently, Jira added a new functionality that allows Jira Admins to copy issue layouts from different projects. 

The problem is that some errors can occur when the source project:
* Was moved to trash
* Is from a different project type

When this happens, Jira just displays a generic error about it. 

h3. Suggestion
It would be very helpful if Jira explains why the operation was not completed.
fields.summary: Improve the error message when copying issue layout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When moving or bulk moving a Sub-task to a Story type, the *Epic Link* field is cleared in the process.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic ➡ Story ➡ Sub-task
# Move the Sub-task to a Story 

h3. Expected Results

Since the Sub-task is already under the Epic, it should keep it when moving to a Story just like Story retains the value which moving to an Epic which is a known bug in [JSWCLOUD-16256|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-16256].

h3. Actual Results

After changing the Sub-task to a Story, it is no longer under the Epic and presumably, this is because the *Epic Link* is inherited.

h3. Workaround

For a manageable amount of Sub-tasks you should use the *Convert to Issue* function itself which retains the Epic link. For larger amounts, the Epic Link field can updated by importing a CSV file exported prior to moving by just mapping the _Issue key_, _Summary_ and _Epic Link_ fields.
fields.summary: Move or bulk move from Sub-tasks to Story removes the Epic Link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having an ampersand "&" in the JQL of a Count in a Filter Count gadget breaks functionality

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Filter Count to your dashboard.
# Set it to any filter or project and 
# Add a Count, setting the JQL that includes a field value that includes an ampersand.
# Save changes, you will see the count value appear in the gadget.
# Press/Click over the Count number

h3. Expected Results
The user is redirected to the Advanced issue search with the gadget JQL + Count JQL indicated and the issues listed/shown.

h3. Actual Results
The user is redirected to the Advanced issue search but left with a broken JQL, breaking at the point of the Count JQL where there is an ampersand. As shown in this video, this seems to be a URL encoding problem as replacing "&" with "%26" (the URL-encoded value for "&") will give the expected result when Clicking/pressing over the count value but it will break the actual count shown (so it is not suitable as a workaround):
 [^Test dashboard - Jira.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Having an ampersand "&" in the JQL of a Count in a Filter Count gadget breaks functionality

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The issue transition does not reflect the latest "*status*" of that issue under the *All issues* section of the project without a hard refresh. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Transition one issue to a different status.
 # Navigate to the All issues page from the issue section. 

h3. Expected Results
The latest status of the issue should be reflected. 

h3. Actual Results
It still shows the old status of that issue.

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page and you should see the latest "status" of the issue in the "All issue" section.
fields.summary: The issue transition does not reflect the latest "status" of that issue under the "All issues" section.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The iFrame macro is used to embed a webpage inside a Confluence page. When adding a Public Dashboard to the iFrame macro, users who don't have a Jira license will get a blank page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*In Jira:*
 # Make sure you have "Allow users to share dashboards and filters with the public" set to ON under General Configurations.
 # Create a Dashboard.
 # Make the Dashboard Public.

*In Confluence*
 # Create a page.
 # Add the iFrame macro to it.
 # Add to the iFrame the link to the Public Dashboard.
 # Try to see it with a test user who has only access to Confluence (do not impersonate the user for this test)

h3. Expected Results

As the Dashboard is set to Public, the user should be able to see it through the iFrame.
h3. Actual Results

The user sees a blank screen on the iFrame:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-21 at 18.57.50.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Although the users see a blank screen, they still have access to Jira's top bar. They can click on *Dashboards > View all dashboards* and select the one they wanna see. The dashboard will then show up.
fields.summary: Users without access to Jira are unable to see Public Dashboards from within the iFrame macro on Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, [deleting projects directly from the archive is not possible in Jira cloud|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-75977]. This causes an unwanted behavior when a user needs to perform a backup for server.

When there are team-managed (next-gen) projects in the archive they are listed in the backup manager as conflicting for server backups and the "Delete all next-gen projects" button is available; however, if this option is used it returns a 500 error because the system attempts to delete the projects directly from the archive and the exception is not caught.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send a team-managed project to the archive
 # Attempt to delete said project from the backup manager interface in the Server backup section

h3. Expected Results
The system should detect that the projects are archived and notify the user to restore them and then delete them until deleting directly from the archive is an option

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the as a 500 error:
{noformat}
Privacy-safe boxing of a java.lang.IllegalStateException
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
The user can restore the projects from the archive and then delete them using the backup manager option.
fields.summary: Clicking the "Delete all next-gen projects" button in the backup manager when the projects are archived returns a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment, when adding [http://portal.office.com/] URL in Description or Comment field , it show "Something Went Wrong" inline URL.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open JIRA issue
 # Add "http://portal.office.com/" and click space

h3. Expected Results

It will automatically render to inline URL , with correct name. For example "Microsoft Portal"
h3. Actual Results

The URL change to inline URL and show "Something went wrong" :-

!Screen Shot 2021-06-01 at 9.06.34 am.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Click the inline and click *Display Inline* . Then , change to *Display URL* :-
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-01 at 9.07.11 am.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Adding http://portal.office.com/ URL in Description or Comment field , it show "Something Went Wrong" inline URL

fields.description:
Ability to hide field when empty into the middle of the issue view, as a description field without moving to the right panel.

Besides, as a user, I'd like to hide fields when empty under all tabs. Follows an example of an option that might be great to include under the issue layout from the General tab. *[Click here to open the idea's example|https://share.getcloudapp.com/Apuz140L].* However, note that this suggestion should be replicated for each TAB.
fields.summary: Ability to hide fields when empty in the middle section and tabs without moving to the right panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira uses "${fullname} (Jira)" as the sender of emails when using the Share action on issues. There's nowhere to change this option, as it does *not* reflect the one selected on /secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa _Email from_  field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a setting for _Email from_ on /secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa
 # Notifications from Jira uses that configuration.
 # Use the Share function on an issue.

h3. Expected Results

Email from Share function should match the one set on the instance, or have somewhere to be set.
h3. Actual Results

Email sender will be like "${fullname} (Jira)".
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator, I'd like to chance the the sender name that appears on emails using the Share function.

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible to select from 7 colors under the Text color drop-down:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-31 at 13.21.48.png|thumbnail! 

It would be better, if we can provide users a more varied template of colors, or let admins customize the default options in the text color selection.
fields.summary: Allow users to select more colors in the text color selection

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is also a possiblity to edit a status when viewing it on the workflow designer. 

But, modifying the status on that view will also change it globally.

There is a warn about the impact, but there is no additional confirmation required when clicking on save:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-31 at 11.13.57.png|thumbnail! 

In case the message is not noticed by the user when editing the status, that may cause a disruptive change on the whole Jira instance since all workflows that are using the status will be impacted.

h3. Suggestion

Add an additional confirmation step when modifying the status with the same message as the static one on the edition scree.
fields.summary: Additional confirmation step when editing a status on the workflow designer

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
It is currently not possible to create an automation rule using a static (standalone) date-time value for comparison. For example : "2020-08-20T13:12:03.1+0000"

h3. Suggestion
We need the functionality where it is possible to use a date like "2020-08-20T13:12:03.1+0000" in conditions to run comparisons.

(i) Currently, functions like {{toDate("2020-08-20T13:12:03.1+0000").plusDays(3)}} are not working consistently as they are doing string comparisions.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to create automation rules involving standalone date comparitions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trying to load the "Rule executions" section on iOS mobile app is loading a blank page. The same problem does not occur on the Android platform.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Jira issue on iOS phone on Jira mobile app
 # Open section "Rule executions"

h3. Expected Results
The section loads fine

h3. Actual Results
The section loads a blank(empty) page

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

(i) The only workaround available at this point is to load "Rule executions" on a computer browser.
fields.summary: As a user on Jira mobile app, opening "Rule executions" on an issue results into blank page on iOS

fields.description: In Jira Server, pressing the icon in the top left corner takes the user to the system dashboard. This feature request is to have the same behavior in Jira Cloud, as some users make heavy use of this and can be confusing for those who migrate from Server to Cloud.
fields.summary: Homologate behavior between Server and Cloud for System dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"The issue no longer exists" error message when pasting an attachment under issue search
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to "Filters" > "Advanced issue search" > search for any issues under a certain project
 # paste a screenshot that is saved on your clipboard

h3. Expected Results
the screenshot should be attached with no error messages

h3. Actual Results
the screenshot is attached but an error message is displayed: "The issue no longer exists": 
 !image-2021-05-31-15-13-06-288.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Open the issue in a new tab and attach the image
fields.summary: "The issue no longer exists" error message when pasting an attachment under issue search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the Atlassian Account language configuration is set for Portuguese (Brazil), the page links are glitched, the file loaded isn't displayed as usual upon its selection and depending on the file size, the button *Next* is greyed out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change Atlassian account language settings to Portuguese (Brazil)
 # Head to External System Import
 # Select CSV
 # See the page web links glitched
 # Upload a CSV file
 # See that the filed uploaded isn't displayed as uploaded
 # If the file is big enough, see that the Next button is greyed out

h3. Expected Results
Import should behave the same regardless of the Atlassian account language settings

h3. Actual Results
Import tool is glitched

h3. Workaround
Change Atlassian account language setting to English
fields.summary: CSV Import in Portuguese is glitched

fields.description: A way to audit who has deleted Items in Jira is badly needed.
fields.summary: Please review decision on JRASERVER-20683

fields.description:
We have a problem where proxies hosted in Azure using Microsoft Defender block the download API URL as it is a generic and has been associated with malicious activity.  When we try to download backups of our cloud environment the download is blocked.  Please can the download API code be hidden behind the site URL.

Having a generic URL means we open our network to potentially downloaded files that we don't trust.
fields.summary: Make downloads available from the service domain rather than generic API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing the default value of the "Message field type" custom field and re-saving it, the previous format is distorted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a default value to the custom field to the "Message field" custom field.
 # Edit the message field and re-save it.

h3. Expected Results
The format and the content should be the same.  

h3. Actual Results
The format is distorted and content also changes in the field. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Message Custom Field changes its format when editing its default value.

fields.description: When you receive a notification email about a certain issue, it would be nice to be able to see the status of the issue without having to open the issue in Jira.
fields.summary: View issue status directly in email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Projects gadget does not render the wiki markup in the detailed view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Projects gadget with the Detailed view
 # Set a Description in the Details page using various text formatting
 # The HTML tags are visible on the gadget instead of being rendered

h3. Expected Results
The HTML tags should not be visible on the gadget 

h3. Actual Results
The HTML tags are visible on the gadget instead of being rendered
 !Screenshot 2021-05-28 at 16.09.51.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2021-05-28 at 16.10.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Projects gadget does not render the wiki markup in detailed view
